intro: Hieraciodes elegans, commonly known as the elegant rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces bright yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Hieraciodes elegans is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitats.
